Pre-Game Insights: The Phoenix Suns (17-19) take the court against the Utah Jazz (9-27) at 5:00 PM ET on Saturday, January 11, 2025.
The Suns were victorious in their most recent game versus the Hawks, 123-115, on Thursday. Bradley Beal was their leading scorer with 25 points.
In their most recent game, the Jazz fell to the Heat on Thursday, 97-92. Their top scorer was Collin Sexton with 23 points.
Devin Booker’s numbers for the season are 24.4 points, 7.0 assists and 3.9 boards per game, shooting 42.9% from the field and 32.5% from downtown, with 2.5 made 3-pointers per game.
Kevin Durant’s numbers for the season are 27.2 points, 6.3 boards and 4.0 assists per game, shooting 52.0% from the floor and 40.3% from beyond the arc, with 2.3 made 3-pointers per game.
Tyus Jones posts 12.2 points, 2.6 boards and 6.0 assists per contest. At the other end, he averages 1.0 steal and 0.1 blocks.
Bradley Beal posts 18.0 points, 3.7 boards and 3.2 assists per contest, shooting 49.3% from the field and 39.2% from beyond the arc, with 2.2 made 3-pointers per contest.

Royce O’Neale’s numbers for the season are 10.5 points, 5.6 boards and 2.4 assists per contest, shooting 44.7% from the floor and 44.1% from beyond the arc (ninth in league), with 2.5 made 3-pointers per contest.
Collin Sexton’s averages for the season are 18.0 points, 2.8 rebounds and 3.9 assists, making 48.0% of his shots from the field and 43.0% from beyond the arc, with 2.0 triples per game.
Walker Kessler adds 10.7 points per game, plus 11.4 boards and 1.6 assists.
The Jazz get 20.0 points, 6.1 boards and 1.9 assists per game from Lauri Markkanen.
John Collins’ averages for the season are 17.9 points, 8.3 rebounds and 2.5 assists, making 52.5% of his shots from the field and 43.8% from beyond the arc, with 1.4 treys per contest.
The Jazz receive 15.6 points per game from Keyonte George, plus 3.4 boards and 5.7 assists.
